com.quinsoft.zeidon.standardoe

Class JavaObjectEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.quinsoft.zeidon.standardoe.JavaObjectEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectEngine

    public class JavaObjectEngine
extends Object
implements ObjectEngine

    This is the standard implementation of the ObjectEngine. The JavaObjectInstance is instantiated using a set of options that the engine uses for configuration. Typical instantiation: 

    
  JavaOeConfiguration configuration = new DefaultJavaOeConfiguration();
  configuration.set....;
  ObjectEngine oe = new JavaObjectEngine( configuration );

      • createTask

        public com.quinsoft.zeidon.standardoe.TaskImpl createTask(String applicationName,
                                                          boolean persistent)
        Description copied from interface: ObjectEngine
        Creates a Zeidon task. If persistent = true then the Object Engine will keep a persistent reference to the task. This means that task.dropTask() *must* be called for it to be released. A non-persistent task will be automatically cleaned up once there are no more application references to the task.
        Specified by:
        createTask in interface ObjectEngine
        Returns:

      • createTask

        public com.quinsoft.zeidon.standardoe.TaskImpl createTask(String applicationName)
        Description copied from interface: ObjectEngine
        Create a NON-persistent Zeidon task. See createTask( String applicationName, boolean persistent ) for more information about persistent tasks.
        Specified by:
        createTask in interface ObjectEngine
        Returns:
        new NON-persistent task.
